summary: Bile duct cancer, also known as cholangiocarcinoma, is a type of cancer that forms in the bile ducts. The bile ducts are small tubes that carry bile from the liver and gallbladder to the small intestine. Bile helps in digesting fats. Bile duct cancer can occur anywhere along the bile ducts, both inside and outside the liver.
risk_factors: Chronic inflammation of the bile ducts
symptoms: Jaundice (yellowing of the skin and eyes)
diagnosis: Imaging tests (e.g., CT scan, MRI, ultrasound)
